byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea.

abstract: Thirty female activists are planning walk across demilitarized zone between North and South Korea to call for permanent peace treaty to replace 1953 armistice that stopped Korean War; nations have not approved event, planned for May 24 International Women's Day for Peace and Disarmament.
lead_paragraph: Leading female advocates of disarmament formally announced their intent to cross the Demilitarized Zone, which has divided the Korean Peninsula since 1953.

headline.main: With Plan to Walk Across DMZ, Women Aim for Peace in Korea
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; South Korea: Women Aim to Cross DMZ in Peace Walk

snippet: Leading female advocates of disarmament formally announced their intent to cross the Demilitarized Zone, which has divided the Korean Peninsula since 1953.

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
keywords.name: subject
